critique: The document is an executive order focused on pollution prevention and community right-to-know. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are joy (from a cleaner environment and safer communities), and a sense of reduced fear (from toxic chemicals). There might be some surprise at the extent of the changes required, but overall the tone is serious and focused on responsibility. The language is formal and legalistic, which tends to dampen strong emotional responses. The document aims to reduce negative emotions like fear and disgust associated with pollution and promote positive emotions linked to environmental protection.
